page.title: 02Gretton village in Survey
page.content: A government survey to list special buildings nationwide is to include Gretton in its lists.The survey for the Department of the Environment started last year and is expected to end in 1987.The aim is to identify buildings which can be legally protected while any proposals to change them are considered.The village of Gretton has been surveyed for many years and buildings with architectural or historic interests will be noted. These will include the church down to various barns. The work organised by Northamptonshire County Council will start in November and is expected to take about a week. The old lists were very selective and apparently a lot of buildings contributing to the character of the place were missed out during the last survey.
